src:
Funchal recebe 20 universidades inglesas em evento da ‘OK Estudante’
‘Casa cheia’ na Calheta em mais um encontro de militantes do PSD
06 Nov 2019, 07:22 by Sandra S. Gonçalves



A ‘OK Estudante’, empresa de consultoria académica especializada e líder em Portugal no encaminhamento de estudantes para universidades britânicas, continua a sua ‘Tour Study in the UK’ na Madeira para apresentar aos jovens a possibilidade de fazerem uma licenciatura ou mestrado no Reino Unido com as propinas 100% financiadas.
A iniciativa realiza-se a 8 de Novembro, no Madeira Tecnopolo, onde já estão confirmados mais de 400 alunos.
Durante a Tour, os Student Advisers da OK Estudante e os representantes das universidades estarão presentes no evento e farão palestras duas vezes ao dia para a apresentar pessoalmente aos estudantes, pais e professores a oportunidade do financiamento e o modelo de ensino britânico.
Maria de Castro, directora geral da ‘OK Estudante’, afirma que “a presença da ‘Tour Study in the UK’ no Funchal é muito importante para garantir que os estudantes de todo o país tenham as mesmas oportunidades de estudar no Reino Unido, se assim o entenderem”.
“Este é também o momento para esclarecer todas as dúvidas, nomeadamente face ao Brexit, e de apresentar a forma como trabalhamos com os alunos e respectivos pais. Mostrar que estamos presentes desde a escolha da instituição e do curso, na formalização da candidatura, passando pelo processo de inscrição, e até no acesso a uma rede de networking, constituída pelos jovens que passaram por este projecto”, acrescenta.
Depois do Funchal, seguem-se as cidades de Leiria (20), Viseu (21) e de Coimbra (22).
Refira-se que, no último ano, 7800 estudantes participaram ‘Tour Study in the UK’ por todo o país.

Lista de universidades britânicas presentes no evento na Madeira

- Anglia Ruskin University, Birmingham City University, Bucks New University, Coventry University, De Montford University, Falmouth University, Middlesex University, NAVITAS, Nottingham Trent University, University College Birmingham, University of Bradford, University of Derby, University of East London, University of Hertfordshire, University of Northumbria, University of Nottingham, University of Portsmouth, University of Sunderland, University of Westminster e University of Worcester.
text:
Funchal hosts 20 English universities at OK Student event
‘Full House’ in Calheta in another PSD militant gathering
06 Nov 2019, 07:22 by Sandra S. Gonçalves



'OK Student', a leading academic advisory firm in Portugal leading students to UK universities, continues its 'Tour Study in the UK' in Madeira to introduce young people to a UK degree or masters degree with the 100% financed tuition fees.
The initiative takes place on November 8 in Madeira Tecnopolo, where more than 400 students are already confirmed.
During the Tour, OK Student Student Advisers and university representatives will attend the event and give twice-daily lectures to personally introduce students, parents and teachers to the opportunity for funding and the British teaching model.
Maria de Castro, Managing Director of OK Student, says that “the presence of the 'Tour Study in the UK' in Funchal is very important to ensure that students across the country have the same opportunities to study in the UK if so they understand ”.
“This is also the time to answer any questions, particularly regarding Brexit, and to present how we work with students and their parents. Show that we are present from the choice of institution and course, in the formalization of the application, through the application process, and even in access to a networking network, made up of young people who have gone through this project, ”he adds.
After Funchal, there are the cities of Leiria (20), Viseu (21) and Coimbra (22).
Last year, 7800 students participated in the 'Tour Study in the UK' across the country.

List of British universities attending the event in Madeira

- Anglia Ruskin University, Birmingham City University, Bucks New University, Coventry University, From Montford University, Falmouth University, Middlesex University, NAVITAS, Nottingham Trent University, University College Birmingham, University of Bradford, University of Derby, University of East London, University of Hertfordshire, University of Northumbria, University of Nottingham, University of Portsmouth, University of Sunderland, University of Westminster and University of Worcester.
